Posts.Content: Sep 7, 2013 04:54PM Heidi9256 wrote: Drago - I am tired.  I'm not sure how much is rads and how much is left over from chemo and sx.  I have been more tired this past week so at least some of it is from the radiation.  I am still functional though - just VERY tired by the end of the day.  Breast is holding up well.  Still crispy and rashy but hasn't got any worse - RO said it might get worse for up to 10 days but it hasn't.  I have appt. with plastic surgeon to quickly begin filling the tissue expanders again so i can have the exchange surgery in October.  I expect that will be very uncomfortable but nothing I don't have a pill for.  Really want to get this exchange done.  Then get the ovaries out.  Then finish Herceptin in Februrary.  Then I'll be done.  More or less.  Well, then there's the 5 years of hormone suppression but i'm not counting that.
Posts.Title: Summer 2013 Rads Wildlyshel sandiesau

Posts.Content: Jul 30, 2013 12:57AM Heidi9256 wrote: Well, had the first of 28 radiation treatments today.  It went well but now I'm feeling somewhat nauseated - like morning sickness.  Great... gonna spend the next 6 weeks reliving my pregnancy.  Time to break into my stash of leftover chemo meds.
Posts.Title: Summer 2013 Rads Wildlyshel sandiesau

Posts.Content: Aug 26, 2013 10:35PM Heidi9256 wrote: Speaking of going naked... I forgot and walked out of the radiation treatment room with the front of my gown/top/wrap thingie wide open.  Fortunately I felt the breeze on the nether regions before I met anyone in the hallway.  I've gotten so used to whipping my foobies out I forget that not everyone wants to see them.
Posts.Title: Summer 2013 Rads Wildlyshel sandiesau

Posts.Content: Sep 8, 2013 02:29AM Heidi9256 wrote: My PS wants to do the exchange surgery 6 weeks from the end of radiation - something about the skin changes from radiation and reducing scar tissue.  He will put it off if he has to but wants to do it then so he can to get the best result.  He's been around a long time and I've seen his work so I trust him.  I had IMRT radiation because it is supposed to be better for reconstruction- leaves you with a better cosmetic result as it keeps most of the radiation away from the pocket that the implants will sit in and you are actually exposed to less radiation with the same medical results as traditional radiation.  I think my skin looks worse than it really is as it is already starting to heal. I'll see what he thinks when he looks at the foobies on Monday.
Posts.Title: Summer 2013 Rads Wildlyshel sandiesau

Posts.Content: Sep 5, 2013 08:16PM Heidi9256 wrote: Had my last radiation today - 28/28 of IMRT with Bolus.  YAY!  My skin on the inner side of my breast area is red, raw and rashy (folliculitis) looking but not too bad.  It's itchy, sore and a little crusty.  The rest of the breast is just very red.  I have occaisional sharp stinging pains in various areas around the breast.  I also have a kickass tanned armpit.
Posts.Title: Summer 2013 Rads Wildlyshel sandiesau

Posts.Content: Apr 17, 2013 12:53AM Heidi9256 wrote: I've been doing a little research for insomnia since chemo has totally screwed me up and found several articles about using melatonin cream to prevent or lessen the skin side effects from radiation - seems to be effective.  FYI: there is also some new research that oral melatonin is effective in reducing chemo side effects and in inhibiting breast cancer tumor cell growth.  Gonna talk to my MO on Thursday and see what she says.
